channel.title: Isreal – Baraza
channel.description: Critical Collaboration on the Middle East, South Asia, and Africa

item.title: The (Jewish) Christian Question
item.dc:creator: Yitzhak Lewis
item.description: A comment on Gil Anidjar’s paper “Jesus and Monotheism” and its discussion at the MESAAS department colloquium on September 11th. Murder, it soon becomes clear, goes far beyond the “who-done-it?” digressions, down which Freud (and Anidjar) takes his readers. This word designates more than a crime, far more than an action. It describes a kind … Continue reading The (Jewish) Christian Question →

item.title: Between Miracle and Afterthought: Hebrew in MESAAS
item.dc:creator: Aviv Becher
item.description: My parents, native Israelis with wide and deep ties to the Hebrew language, insisted, always, on maintaining a Hebrew-speaking household in the U.S. so that my two sisters and I might carry on in the world with “a miracle” of a language at our disposal. I remember my father telling me excitedly that, “before 1948, … Continue reading Between Miracle and Afterthought: Hebrew in MESAAS →

item.title: Never-Ending Story: The American Press Fails on Iran
item.dc:creator: Roxanne Emadi
item.description: The big, bad Iran nuclear threat is one of the American news media’s favorite evergreen stories. Year after year, it picks up where it left off: Enrichment, sanctions, red lines, the usual. In November, the media circus on Iran exploded. From Foreign Affairs’ catastrophe “Time to attack Iran,” to The New York Times Magazine’s seemingly-million-word “Will Israel attack … Continue reading Never-Ending Story: The American Press Fails on Iran →

item.title: Good War/Bad Terror: Morality, Violence, and the (De)Valuation of Palestinian Life
item.dc:creator: Marianna Reis
item.description: Last Friday, the Israeli Air Force killed two members of the Palestinian Resistance Committee in Gaza, who were believed to be planning an attack on Israel from the Egyptian Sinai some time in the following days. This sparked an onslaught of rocket attacks from Gaza into Southern Israel, and Israeli airstrikes on Gaza, with civilian … Continue reading Good War/Bad Terror: Morality, Violence, and the (De)Valuation of Palestinian Life →

item.title: Palestine and the Fight for Water Access
item.dc:creator: Marianna Reis
item.description: “Israel is a small piece of land. We are not even 1 percent of the Arab space, you know. We don’t have water. We don’t have oil. Our greatness, if one may say greatness, stems from the fact we had nothing to start with. So we turned to human talent because there weren’t natural resources. … Continue reading Palestine and the Fight for Water Access →
